name: Tayba Foundation
mission:
Tayba aims to become a pioneer—the first to offer a complete, high-quality online curriculum featuring engaging visual and audio instruction Our programs SOURCE: Self-reported by organization What are the organization's current programs, how do they measure success,
            and who do the programs serve? Education At Tayba, we believe that character reformation gives incarcerated clients and the formerly incarcerated the tools they need to successfully reintegrate into society following parole.
theoryOfChange: Tayba believes that providing Islamic education and life skills tools unlocks human potential and mitigates the possibility of future incarceration.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: RELIGIOUS_CULTURAL (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 32/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: TAYBA FOUNDATION earns 63/100 due to good alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.taybafoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.taybafoundation.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The organization has a Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100, a program expense ratio of 84.6%, 6.7 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.18 per $1 raised.
The Tayba Foundation is Zakat-eligible and maintains a specific Zakat distribution policy.
The organization reported a total revenue of $1,460,391.
Tayba Foundation provides education, life skills, and re-entry programs to help incarcerated clients reintegrate into society.
The organization offers opportunities for volunteer engagement and board participation.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Tayba Foundation demonstrates strong financial health and transparency, though its impact score is moderated by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external third-party impact evaluations beyond self-reported recidivism data
Opportunities to expand volunteer engagement and board diversity [6]

dimension_explanations.alignment: Tayba Foundation is Zakat-eligible and serves a specific religious and cultural niche, making it a medium-to-strong fit for Muslim donors seeking to support justice-involved individuals [2]. Its mission addresses the urgent cause of prisoner rehabilitation through a faith-based lens [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through education, reporting that character reformation is key to reducing recidivism among its clients [4]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 84.6%, the cost per beneficiary is approximately $511.54, reflecting the intensive nature of its educational and re-entry services [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Tayba Foundation provides holistic education and re-entry support to incarcerated individuals to foster character reformation and successful societal reintegration.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 84.6%, indicating most funds go directly to services [1]
Strong financial health with 6.7 months of working capital available [1]
Efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.18 to raise every $1 [1]
baseline_narrative.summary: The Tayba Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to serving incarcerated and formerly incarcerated clients through a comprehensive curriculum of Islamic education, life skills, and re-entry programs [4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $1,460,391 and maintains a high level of financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100 [1][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Tayba Foundation demonstrates strong financial health and transparency, though its impact score is moderated by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.

areas_for_improvement.context: While impact is tracked, the organization's <cite id="1">theory of change is currently classified as developing</cite> and would benefit from a more formal causal pathway document.
There is a <cite id="1">lack of external third-party impact evaluations</cite> to verify the self-reported 100% non-recidivism rate.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards consistent with a 94.25 CN score.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization mitigates these risks through high transparency and a <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Developing status of formal theory of change</cite>
<cite id="1">Limited board size (6 members)</cite> compared to larger national institutions
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="1">niche focus on incarcerated individuals</cite>, which may not align with donors seeking broad-based humanitarian relief.

confidence.notes: Strong financial and accountability data available.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving <cite id="2">eight specific asnaf categories</cite> including the poor and those in debt.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Tayba due to its <cite id="1">perfect scores in Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator and its <cite id="1">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could <cite id="1">document a clear theory of change</cite> with a formal causal pathway.

impact.explanation: Operations are efficient with a <cite id="1">84.6% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary of $511.54</cite>, which is standard for intensive educational programs.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">building working capital reserves</cite> further to ensure multi-year program sustainability.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Outcome tracking with self-reported metrics

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery through internal programs

rich_narrative.headline: Tayba Foundation provides holistic education and re-entry support to incarcerated individuals to foster character reformation and successful societal reintegration.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value the transformative power of Islamic education and want to support the successful reintegration of incarcerated Muslims into society.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through a specialized US-based program
Believe in rehabilitation and character reformation over simple punishment
Value high transparency and top-tier charity ratings
Interested in supporting an underserved and often stigmatized population
giving_considerations: The organization serves a niche population with high-touch, long-term interventions
Impact is measured through recidivism rates rather than immediate physical aid
Donations support spiritual and educational infrastructure
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate international disaster relief or those who prefer funding large-scale physical infrastructure projects.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that the organization <cite id="1">tracks two specific outcome metrics</cite> and reports a 100% non-recidivism rate, but lacks independent RCT-level validation.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Tayba creates impact by providing <cite id="4">Islamic education and life skills</cite> to inmates, which reforms character and <cite id="4">reduces recidivism</cite> upon release.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in the re-entry space is critical to prove that spiritual education leads to lower crime rates and successful societal participation.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a $1.5M organization in a high-need space, Tayba has significant capacity to expand its curriculum to more facilities.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="1">94.25 overall CN score</cite> and unique focus on <cite id="4">prison chaplaincy and re-entry</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on disability services rather than incarceration

strengths.detail: The organization maintains an <cite id="1">overall score of 94.94.25/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong governance and <cite id="1">100% independent board members</cite>.
Tayba operates with remarkable efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.18 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The charity maintains <cite id="1">6.7 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, ensuring long-term stability.

strengths_deep_dive: Tayba Foundation's operational strength lies in its ability to deliver high-impact services with a relatively small budget. Their <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 84.6%</cite> exceeds the industry standard of 75%, ensuring that the majority of donor funds reach the incarcerated students. Furthermore, the organization holds a <cite id="1">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>, the highest level available, which is supported by their <cite id="1">tracking of specific outcome metrics</cite> such as student progress and recidivism rates. Their leadership has demonstrated consistent growth, achieving a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 11.2%</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Tayba Foundation is a specialized non-profit organization dedicated to providing <cite id="4">holistic Islamic education and re-entry support</cite> to incarcerated individuals across the United States. By focusing on character reformation through a <cite id="4">comprehensive online curriculum</cite>, the organization addresses the spiritual and practical needs of a deeply underserved population. In the 2023 tax year, Tayba reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $1,460,391</cite>, maintaining a lean operation where <cite id="1">84.6% of expenses are directed to program services</cite>. The organization has achieved significant recognition for its niche focus, including being <cite id="1">featured on CBS's State of Spirituality with Lisa Ling</cite>, which highlighted its mission to foster successful societal reintegration. With an <cite id="1">overall Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100</cite>, Tayba demonstrates a high level of institutional maturity and financial transparency. Their model is particularly unique in the American Muslim landscape, as it combines <cite id="4">traditional Islamic scholarship</cite> with modern <cite id="4">life skills and recidivism prevention</cite> strategies, claiming a <cite id="4">non-recidivism rate of 100%</cite> among its core student base.
